releases.name: Karma Release v2.052
releases.body:
1. Github Integration - Ability to push models and model related files directly to github
2. Bug Fixes

releases.name: Karma Version v2.051
releases.body:
### Release Highlights:
1. Ability to Set Java Home from the [One click Karma Installer](https://github.com/usc-isi-i2/Web-Karma/wiki/Installation%3A-One-Click-Install)
2. Show rdfs:label in English by default

releases.name: Karma Release v2.049
releases.body:
## Release Highlights:
- New [one-click installation for Karma](https://github.com/usc-isi-i2/Web-Karma/wiki/Installation%3A-One-Click-Install)
- Show rdfs:label for Classes and Properties
- Upgrade to latest fileupload and apache httpcomponents libraries

releases.name: Karma Version 2.048
releases.body:
## Release Highlights:
- Show rdfs:label for Classes and Properties
- New [one-click installation for Karma](https://github.com/usc-isi-i2/Web-Karma/wiki/Installation%3A-One-Click-Install)

releases.name: Release from v2.047 for ODEUM
releases.body: # Karma Tomcat Installation 1. Install JDK 1.7 and set JAVA_HOME environment variable to point to it. Add JAVA_HOME/bin to your PATH environment variable. 2. Install Tomcat 7. 3. Setting Tomcat a. If tomcat is running, shut it down. b. Make sure unpackWars is set to true in conf/server.xml ``` ``` c. Remove the ROOT Tomcat webapp ``` cd apache-tomcat-7.0.55/webapps rm â€“rf ROOT ``` d. Copy all war files from the Release's Downloads to the tomcat webapps folder `cp karmaRelease/*.war apache-tomcat-7.0.55/webapps` 4. You would need to increase the amount of memory allocated to karma. To do so, change CATALINA_OPTS to use memory greater than Xmx1024m. Example: ``` export CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -Xms2048m" export CATALINA_OPTS="$CATALINA_OPTS -Xmx4096m" ``` 5. Start tomcat ``` cd apache-tomcat-7.0.55/bin /startup.sh ``` Karma will now be available on port 8080: http://localhost:8080 ## Troubleshooting 1. Tomcat cannot start. Port 8080 is already in use Change the port in apache-tomcat-7.0.55/conf/server.xml. Search for 8080 and replace it with a different port, say 8888 ``` ``` 2. I get java.lang.ClassNotFoundException: com.mysql.jdbc.Driver when I load a table from MySQL Copy the mysql-connector-java-xx.jar to apache-tomcat-7.0.55/lib folder and restart tomcat # Karma Batch Mode Follow instructions on the wiki for working with karma in batch mode once you have created the karma models - https://github.com/usc-isi-i2/Web-Karma/wiki/Batch-Mode For using it in a closed environment, instead of the commands that use maven on the wiki ``` mvn exec:java -Dexec.mainClass="edu.isi.karma.rdf.OfflineRdfGenerator" -Dexec.args=" --sourcetype \ --filepath \ --modelfilepath \ --sourcename \ --outputfile " -Dexec.classpathScope=compile ``` Use the version below that uses the karma-offline JAR instead ``` java -cp karma-offline-0.0.1-SNAPSHOT-shaded.jar edu.isi.karma.rdf.OfflineRdfGenerator \ --sourcetype \ --filepath \ --modelfilepath \ --sourcename \ --outputfile ```

releases.name: Release version 2.047
releases.body:
1. Added Split Column by Regular Expression
2. Bug Fixes

releases.name: v2.046
releases.body:
1. Support for Language Tags
2. Bug Fixes

releases.name: v2.030 Patch 4: Handles cases when input is missing columns in some rows
releases.body: Patch to v2.030 to handle missing columns. If a column data is missing from the XMl/JSON for some rows, it continues execution.

releases.name: v2.030 Patch 3 - Handles missing columns
releases.body: Patch to v2.030 to handle missing columns. If a column is missing, but being used in a command, it creates a new column with empty values so the command can succeed.

releases.name: v2.030 Patch Release for Glue Column Command Bug Fix
releases.body:
Patch to v2.030.
Fixes issue to Apply Model containing Glue Column Command

releases.name: v2.030 Release
releases.body:
Includes:
- Split Values Command
- Bug Fixes

releases.name: v2.028 Release for Sprint 2
releases.body:
-    Bug Fixes
-   Selecting only subset of columns for a source at load time
-   Handling large Ontologies in Manual Mode
-   Typeahead in Set Semantic Type for Classes and Properties in case of large Ontologies
-   Clear Indicator of Manual Mode in Karma Header

releases.name: v2.027 Release
releases.body:
- Bug Fixes
- Selecting only subset of columns for a source at load time
- Typeahead in Set Semantic Type for Classes and Properties in case of large Ontologies

releases.name: v2.026 Release
releases.body:
- Bug fixes and performance improvements.
- Ability to read and write AVRO files.
- Karma RDF generation service
- New Semantic Typing using Lucene

releases.name: Alternative Blank Node Generation
releases.body:
Adds the ability to generate blank nodes for subjects with no matching data properties.  

To enable, edit or create KARMA_USER_HOME/Config/kr2rml.properties and set
template.terms.no.minimum.for.blank.nodes=true

releases.name: Blank Node handling when generating RDF for SRI
releases.body:
Release includes:
1. Blank Node handling when generating RDF
2. A manual mode for entering classes and properties when the size of the ontology is too large
3. Footer to quickly change karma home directory
4. Bug fixes

releases.name: Blank Node handling when generating RDF for SRI
releases.body:
Release includes:
1. Blank Node handling when generating RDF
2. A manual mode for entering classes and properties when the size of the ontology is too large
3. Footer to quickly change karma home directory
4. Bug fixes

releases.name: WAR deployment fixes for Transform command for SRI
Code restructure into projects, WAR deployment for jetty, tomcat for SRI
releases.body:
- Code restructure into projects
- New Commands: Publish Report, Save as JSON, Fold, Unfold, Groupby, Delete Worksheet, Organize Columns
- New UI
- Works when deployed as WAR in jetty or tomcat containers.
- Bug fixes

releases.name: Release with JSONRDFGenerator for SRI
releases.body: Includes the JSONRDFGenerator class for registering models and using them at query execution time. Take a look at src/test/java/edu/isi/karma/rdf/TestJSONRDFGenerator.java for an example of how to use it.
